author: @Nyasatimess
title: Synod of Livingstonia against culture of burying the dead with items - Malawi Nyasa Times - News from Malawi about Malawi
text: Synod of Livingstonia against culture of burying the dead with items The CCAP Synod of Livingstonia has queried the culture of burying the dead with precious items saying in some cases it aggravates poverty. ‘ The Moderator of Nthungwa Congregation Rev. Edward ‘Jembe’ Chirwa made the remarks at Chipumulo in the area of Traditional Authority (T/A) Kampingo Sibande in Mzimba recently during the burial ceremony of Eliness Magompho who died at Mzuzu Central Hospital (MCH) after succumbing to a battle of low sugar disease. During the ceremony, relatives to the deceased buried some precious items like blankets, mats among others as a sign of respect and love. In his eulogy , Group Village Headman (GVH) Chibwana Nyangu said in Magompho, the community had lost “a real Christian and a mother group leader in the quest for right to education for victims of early child marriages hence she deserved the respect, love and a decent send off. “No words can describe the depth of our shock and sadness at the heart-breaking news” GVH Chibwana Nyangu said. But Jembe Chirwa addressing hundreds of mourners said elsewhere he also witnessed relatives took new mattresses, blankets and buried with the dead leaving children suffering with no mat to sleep on neither blanket to cover themselves during this cold weather, prompting other well-wishers to render support, hence he felt duty bound to voice out to the masses to get a lesson from. “When something goes wrong, we have to speak out. We are civic educators and we have to say it for the sake of people to learn a lesson from,” Rev. Jembe Chirwa said. But when we sought views from a historian and a cultural man of the Ngoni ethnic group, Aupson Ndabazake Thole, who is also the Secretary for Esangweni Elders Association(EEA) within Mzimba Heritage Association (MZIHA) of the M’mbelwa Chief Council, he defended the deceased family including friends for their action, saying that burying someone with items, is an old culture as old kings like Pharaohs were buried with precious items that they used. Thole noted that the culture which was practiced in many African ethnic groups has high sense of attachment to ancestral spirits such as sense of belonging and sense of collectivism, so when one dies, the living are afraid of the unknown hence the dead need to be buried with respect and love. He said, as a result they try to appease the spirit of the dead. Said Thole: “Apart from appeasement, everybody is suspicious that if we leave the items like blankets that the dead person used when he was ill, who is going to use them? Adding that the living don’t share items with the dead. The Ngoni cultural group spokesperson added that culture says the spirit of the dead shall be visiting you during the night. But, Thole, however said, It is not that all the items are buried with the dead but a few that the deceased used. These cannot be given to children because the ancestral spirit cannot accept.Follow and Subscribe Nyasa TV :

author: @eltreceoficial
title: Qué dijo Lizy Tagliani sobre su furia en vivo contra un operador de Olga
text:
Lizy Tagliani está incómoda y se le nota demasiado. En una entrevista con el cronista de Puro Show, la conductora decidió cortar abruptamente la nota y retirarse manejando del lugar.
“Es un gesto de maltratador, ponele por ejemplo que no te traen el cafecito acá. Voy a decir ‘che, hace una hora que pedí el cafecito’, y lo hiciste así, al aire. Es que sos un maltratador”, empezó comentando Fernanda Iglesias respecto del gesto agresivo que tuvo Lizy Tagliani con un productor en el canal de streaming Olga.
“Y es peor cuando te jactás, porque cuando pasó todo lo de Viviana (Canosa), Lizy se jactó de ser una gran persona, de ser muy querida. Entonces, cuando vos te jactás de algo y suceden estas cosas, decís ‘pará’”, agregó Pochi.
“Lo que estoy diciendo es que no la quieren en Olga”, agregó Fernanda, para luego mostrar la entrevista del cronista de Puro Show a la conductora.
“Hola Lizy, cómo estás?”, le preguntó el periodista. “Todo bien, por suerte”, fue su respuesta desde su auto.
“¿Qué pasó con tu productor en Olga? ¿Fue una pelea o todo fue en chiste?”, le consultó. “No, es un chiste”, respondió.
“Porque llamó la atención que después no estaba subido en YouTube, habían sacado esa parte”, le comentó.
La incomodidad de Lizy Tagliani
“La verdad, es una decisión de ellos, no tengo ni idea”, respondió, incómoda.
“¿Pasó algo con (Carlos) Monti, estás enojada? Porque no quisiste hablar con el cronista de él”, fue la siguiente pregunta.
“No, para nada… No quiero hablar del tema del que ya todos saben”, respondió, mientras avanzaba con su auto para alejarse del lugar.
“Eso sigue en la Justicia, ya lo aclaraste muchas veces”, le dijo el cronista. “Sí, sí, como corresponde”, contestó.
“Con respecto al tema de la adopción, ¿hubo postergación?”, le preguntó, y su respuesta fue subir la ventanilla sin contestar y arrancar.
